doc.previous: In Southern England vales commonly occur between the escarpment slopes of pairs of chalk formations where the chalk dome has been eroded exposing less resistant underlying rock usually clay  In geography a vale is a wide river valley usually with a particularly wide flood plain or flat valley bottom
doc.after: There are various forms of valley associated with glaciation that may be referred to as glacial valleys
